item.title: T-Test is not BEST
item.description: Introduction In this post, we explore the task of comparing groups of measurements. Everyone knows about the T-Test and everyone uses it. Yet, there are better methods for drawing inferences from two independent groups’ (Kruschke, 2013; Morey & Rouder, 2015). Let’s talk about how “Bayesian estimation supersedes the t-test” (Kruschke, 2013). In that article (Bayesian estimation supersedes the t-test) Kruschke (2013) provided clear and well-reasoned arguments favoring Bayesian parameter estimation over null hypothesis significance testing in the context of comparing two groups, a situation which is usually dealt with a t-test.
